meanings.sent1: She was cognizant of the time ticking away as she worked on her project.
meanings.sent2: He is always cognizant of his surroundings when walking alone at night.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed cognizant of the fact that it was being watched, as it slyly glanced around.
meanings.sent4: The old tree, cognizant of its age, stood tall and proud in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The child's eyes were wide and cognizant, taking in every detail of the colorful painting.

meanings.definition: Having knowledge or understanding of something
meanings.sent1: The professor is cognizant of various theories in the field of physics.
meanings.sent2: She became cognizant of the importance of time management after missing several deadlines.
meanings.sent3: The robot, cognizant of its programming, followed the commands precisely.
meanings.sent4: His eyes were cognizant of the hidden emotions behind her smile.
meanings.sent5: The detective's keen and cognizant mind quickly pieced together the clues of the mystery.
